lines.content: This is a project template for a greenfield Java project. It's named after the Java mascot _Duke_. Given below are instructions on how to use it.
Prerequisites: JDK 11, update Intellij to the most recent version.
1. Open Intellij (if you are not in the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close the existing project first)
1. Open the project into Intellij as follows:
1. Select the project directory, and click `OK`.
1. If there are any further prompts, accept the defaults.
1. Configure the project to use **JDK 11** (not other versions) as explained in [here](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/idea/sdk.html#set-up-jdk).
In the same dialog, set the **Project language level** field to the `SDK default` option.

3. After that, locate the `src/main/java/duke.Duke.java` file, right-click it, and choose `Run duke.Duke.main()` (if the code editor is showing compile errors, try restarting the IDE). If the setup is correct, you should see something like the below as the output:
implementation group: 'org.openjfx', name: 'javafx-base', version: javaFxVersion, classifier: 'win'
implementation group: 'org.openjfx', name: 'javafx-base', version: javaFxVersion, classifier: 'mac'

implementation group: 'org.openjfx', name: 'javafx-controls', version: javaFxVersion, classifier: 'mac'
implementation group: 'org.openjfx', name: 'javafx-controls', version: javaFxVersion, classifier: 'linux'

implementation group: 'org.openjfx', name: 'javafx-fxml', version: javaFxVersion, classifier: 'mac'
implementation group: 'org.openjfx', name: 'javafx-fxml', version: javaFxVersion, classifier: 'linux'
implementation group: 'org.openjfx', name: 'javafx-graphics', version: javaFxVersion, classifier: 'win'

implementation group: 'org.openjfx', name: 'javafx-graphics', version: javaFxVersion, classifier: 'linux'
* AddCommand class implements the {@link Command} interface and is used to add a new task to the {@link Tasklist}.
* It takes a {@link Task} object as input in its constructor.
* Constructs an AddCommand object and initializes it with the new task to be added to the task list.
* @param newTask the task to be added to the task list
* Adds the new task to the task list.
public String execute(Ui ui, Tasklist list, Storage storage) {
* This is an interface representing a command that can be executed.
* This method is called to execute the command.
* @param ui The user interface to interact with the user.
* @param list The task list containing the tasks.
* @param storage The storage where the data is stored.
public String execute(Ui ui, Tasklist list, Storage storage);
* The DeleteCommand class represents a Command that implements the "delete" functionality in the task list application.
* It deletes a task from the task list based on its index.
* Constructs a new DeleteCommand with the specified task index.
* @param index the index of the task to be deleted.
* Executes the delete command by calling the {@link Tasklist#deleteTask(int)} method
public String execute(Ui ui, Tasklist list, Storage storage) {
* The ExitCommand class implements the Command interface and represents the command to exit the Duke application.
public String execute(Ui ui, Tasklist list, Storage storage) {
* A class representing a command to find tasks with a certain keyword in the task list.
* Constructs a FindCommand with the specified keyword.
* @param keyword the keyword to be searched for
* Executes the command to find tasks with the specified keyword in the task list.
* @param ui the user interface to display the result of the command
* @param list the task list to search for tasks
* @param storage the storage for saving the task list
public String execute(Ui ui, Tasklist list, Storage storage) {
* The ListCommand class implements the Command interface.
*  It is responsible for displaying the list of tasks stored in the Tasklist.
* * Executes the ListCommand by calling the inString() method
public String execute(Ui ui, Tasklist list, Storage storage) {

* represents a command to mark a task in the task list as done.

* Executes this command by marking the task with the specified index in the
* @param ui the user interface to use for input/output
* @param storage the storage backend to use for persistence
public String execute(Ui ui, Tasklist list, Storage storage) {
* The UnMarkCommand class implements the Command interface and
* represents the command for unmarking a task in the task list.
* The index of the task to be unmarked
* Unmarks the task at the specified index in the task list
* @param ui The user interface used to display information to the user
* @param list The task list being operated on
* @param storage The storage backend used to persist the task list
public String execute(Ui ui, Tasklist list, Storage storage) {
* The main class for the Duke task management application.
* Constructor for the Duke class, which takes in a file path as a parameter.
* @param filePath The file path to the backend storage file.
* Starts processing the user's input by parsing it into a command and executing it.
* @param input the user's input to process
* @return the result of executing the command generated from the user's input
* Processes the user's input and returns the Duke's response.
* @param input the user's input to process
* @return the Duke's response to the user's input
* The Launcher class is responsible for starting the JavaFX application
* by calling the launch method of the Application class.
* The Parser class is responsible for parsing the user's input and returning the appropriate command.
* @param input The user's input to be parsed.
* Parses the user input and returns the corresponding command object.
* @return The command object corresponding to the user input.
* @throws DukeException If the input is not recognized or is invalid.
throw new DukeException("Oh no!! Fill in the description of a todo.");
throw new DukeException("Oh no!! Fill in the description of a deadline.");
throw new DukeException("Oh no!! Please specify the deadline.");
throw new DukeException("Oh no! Fill in the description for this event .");
throw new DukeException("Oh no!! Please specify the start and end.");
Event eventTask = new Event(splitDescriptionAndDuration[0], startDate, endDate);
throw new DukeException("Oh no!!! What is this? Please try again!");

* The `Storage` class is responsible for loading and saving tasks to/from a file.
* Creates a `Storage` object with the specified file path.
* @param filePath the file path to be used for storage
* Saves the specified `Tasklist` to the file.
* @param tasklist the tasklist to be saved
* Creates or opens the file specified in the `filePath` field.
* Loads tasks from the file and returns them in a list.
* @return a list of tasks loaded from the file
* @throws DukeException if there is an error reading the file
throw new DukeException("Error parsing file, unexpected task type");
* This class handles all the user interface interactions.
* It provides methods to show a welcome message, read user input,
* show a separator line, close the Scanner, and display error messages.
* Constructor that initializes the Scanner to read input from the standard input.
* Show the welcome message to the user.
* @return The welcome message to the user.
stringBuilder.append("What's up! I'm duuk.What do you want?");
* Displays the error message to the user.
* @param message the error message to be displayed.
return ("Oh no there is an error:" + message);
* Returns a string representation of the reply for a successfully deleted task.
* @param listSize The current size of the task list.
* @return A string representation of the reply.
public String getDeleteReply(Task deletedTask, int listSize) {
stringBuilder.append("Now you have " + listSize + " tasks in the list.");
* Returns a string representation of the reply for a successfully added task.
* @return A string representation of the reply.
stringBuilder.append("Got it. I've added this task:\n " + addedTask.toString());
* Returns a string representation of the reply for a list of tasks matching a description.
* @param tasklist The list of tasks matching the description.
* @return A string representation of the reply.
stringBuilder.append("Oh no you don't have any matching tasks.\n");
stringBuilder.append("Here are the tasks that matches yor description:\n");
* Returns a string representation of the reply for the full list of tasks.
* @param tasklist The full list of tasks.
* @return A string representation of the reply.
* Returns the reply to be displayed after marking a task as done.
* @param markedTask The task that was marked as done.
stringBuilder.append("Nice! I've marked this task as done:\n").append(markedTask.toString());
* Returns the reply to be displayed after unmarking a task as not done.
* @param unMarkedTask The task that was unmarked as done.
* Returns the reply to be displayed before exiting the program.
return "Bye. Hope to see you again soon!";
* The DukeException class represents a custom exception thrown in the program.
* It extends the Exception class and provides a constructor that accepts a string as input.
* Constructs a DukeException with the specified detail message.
* An example of a custom control using FXML.
* This control represents a dialog box consisting of an ImageView to represent the speaker's face and a label
* Flips the dialog box such that the ImageView is on the left and text on the right.
public static DialogBox getUserDialog(String text, Image img) {
public static DialogBox getDukeDialog(String text, Image img) {
* A GUI for Duke using FXML.
* Controller for MainWindow. Provides the layout for the other controls.
* Initializes the JavaFX controller, binds the scrollPane to the dialogContainer's heightProperty,
* creates a new Ui instance to handle user interface interactions, displays a welcome message from the Ui,
* and adds the Duke dialog containing the welcome message to the dialogContainer.
* Creates two dialog boxes, one echoing user input and the other containing Duke's reply and then appends them to
* the dialog container. Clears the user input after processing.
* The Deadline class extends the Task class and represents a deadline task.
* It contains a due date which is a local date.
* Constructor for the Deadline class which takes in a name and a due date.
* @param dueDate  due date of the task
* Overrides the toSaveFormat method in the super class to add the due date.
* Overrides the toString method in the super class to add the due date.
* @return a string in the format "[D] [status icon] [name] ([dueDate])"
* The `Event` class represents an event task in the to-do list.
* It extends the `Task` class and contains additional information
* about the start and end date of the event.
* Constructor that creates an instance of the `Event` class
* @param name the name of the event task
* @param startDetails the start date of the event task
* @param endDetails the end date of the event task
public Event(String name, LocalDate startDetails, LocalDate endDetails) {
* Overrides the `toSaveFormat` method from the `Task` class to return
* a formatted string that contains the type of the task, its name,
* start date and end date. The format of the string is as follows:
* "E" + divider + markToInt + divider + name + divider + startDetails + divider + endDetails;
* @return a formatted string that can be saved to a file
return TASKSAVESYMBOL + super.toSaveFormat() + DIVIDER + startDetails + DIVIDER + endDetails;
* Overrides the `toString` method from the `Task` class to return
* a string representation of the event task. The format of the string is as follows:
* @return a string representation of the event task
* A task has a name and a mark indicating whether it's done or not.
* Constructs a new task with the given name.
* @param name the name of the task
* Returns the status icon of the task, either "X" or " ".
* @return the status icon of the task
* Returns whether the current Task's name contains the specified keyword.
* @param keyword the keyword to search for in the task's name
* @return true if the task's name contains the specified keyword, false otherwise
* Returns the task in a format suitable for saving.
* @return the task in a format suitable for saving
* Returns a string representation of the task.
* @return a string representation of the task
* The `Tasklist` class manages a list of `Task` objects and their storage.
* Default constructor for the Tasklist class.
* Initializes a new empty ArrayList of Task and
* a new Storage object with the file path "./data/duke.txt".
* Constructor for the Tasklist class. Initializes a new Tasklist with the specified list and backend.
* @param list the list of tasks to initialize the Tasklist with
* @param backend the storage backend to initialize the Tasklist with
* Adds a task to the task list and saves the updated task list to the backend.
* @param task the task to add to the task list
* Marks a task in the task list as done and saves the updated task list to the backend.
* @param index the index of the task to mark as done
* Unmarks a task in the task list and saves the updated task list to the backend.
* @param index the index of the task to unmark
* Deletes a task from the task list and saves the updated task list to the backend.
* @param index the index of the task to delete
* Returns the number of tasks in the list.
* @return an integer representing the number of tasks in the list
* Returns the task at the specified index.
* @param index the index of the task to retrieve
* @return the task at the specified index
* Returns a new Tasklist containing all tasks in the current list that contain the specified keyword.
* @param keyword the keyword to match against task descriptions
* @return a new Tasklist containing all tasks that match the specified keyword
* Returns whether the current Tasklist is empty.
* @return true if the current Tasklist is empty, false otherwise
* Returns a string representation of the Tasklist.
* @return a string representation of the Tasklist
* Todo is a subclass of {@link Task} that adds its own implementation for the toSaveFormat() and toString() methods.
* Constructor to create a new Todo instance with the specified name.
* @param name the name of the Todo task.
* Overridden method that returns the Todo task in the format "T[mark][divider][task name]" where
* mark is "1" if the task is marked done, and "0" otherwise. divider is the static final.
* @return the Todo task in the format "T[mark][divider][task name]"
* Overridden method that returns the Todo task as a string in the format "[T][status icon][task name]" where
* status icon is "X" if the task is marked done, and " " otherwise.
* @return the Todo task as a string in the format "[T][status icon][task name]"
